question: Has strimvelis been approved by the European Medicines Agency?
ideal_answer: Yes, the gene therapy Strimvelis has been approved by the European Medicines Agency.

snippets.text: Strimvelis (autologous CD34+ cells transduced to express adenosine deaminase [ADA]) is the first ex vivo stem cell gene therapy approved by the European Medicines Agency (EMA), indicated as a single treatment for patients with ADA-severe combined immunodeficiency (ADA-SCID) who lack a suitable matched related bone marrow donor.
